bibl.title: Military Orders regarding Frank H. Edmunds, June 18, 1901

div1.p: General Orders #10 lists military stations and various ranks for Edmunds up to his death by yellow fever on June 18, 1901. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders regarding Frank H. Edmunds, June 18, 1901
div1.p:
Adjutant General's
OFFICE.
JUL 2 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.
[unclear]

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 179 B 1900

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
AND PINAR DEL RIO.

With profound sorrow the Department Commander
announces the death of Major Frank H. Edmunds, 1st
Infantry, Acting Inspector General of the Depart-
ment, which occurred at Quemados, Cuba, on this
date.

Major Edmunds was born in the State of Michigan,
appointed to the Military Academy from Dakota;
graduated in 1871, and was appointed 2d lieutenant,
1st Infantry, in which regiment he served until he
was appointed major of the 15th Infantry on the 2d
of March, 1899; being transferred back to the 1st In-
fantry on the 18th of May of the same year.

During the Spanish-American War he was a Major
and Chief Ordnance Officer from the 18th of July,
1898, until he was honorably discharged from the
volunteer service on the 12th of May, 1899.

He was appointed Acting Inspector General and
assigned to the staff of the Department Commander
on June 20, 1899, and has since served most satisfac-
torily in that capacity.

The services of this accomplished and well equipped
officer are well known. He was without fear and
without reproach. His character was exalted, his life
pure. The army has lost one of its best soldiers, his
regiment one of its truest members, the Department a
conscientious officer of inflexible integrity. He has
gone to his eternal rest without a blot upon the pol-
ished armor of his official record, and without a stain
upon a blameless private career.

The usual badge of mourning will be worn by mem-
bers of the Staff for thirty days.
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:

R. E. L. MICHIE,
Assistant Adjutant General.
